docblock.description: PHP Class: Basecamp
docblock.long-description:
This class allows you to connect to the new Basecamp API. It is not compatible with the Basecamp Classic API. This class contains its own built-in RESTful service.

The Basecamp class is fully cusomizable and easy to use!

docblock.description: An array containing any errors, use getter
Basecamp primary account ID, use setters/getters
Basecamp username, use setters/getters
Basecamp password, use setters/getters
Application name using this library
Content type, Basecamp requires JSON
Basecamp base URL
Basecamp API Version
Stored RESTful request
Stored RESTful Response
The full built URL
Initialization
docblock.long-description:
The Basecamp constructor doesn't require the arguments, you can set them afterwards.

Here's an example of instantiation:

required_once 'libraries/basecamp.php';

$basecamp = new Basecamp('My App', 123456, 'tjones', 'abc123');

docblock.description: Retrieve all accesses for a specific project

tag.name: return
tag.description: List of people with access to the project

docblock.description: Retrieve all accesses for a specific calendar

tag.name: return
tag.description: List of people with access to the calendar

docblock.description: Grant access to a specific project
docblock.long-description:
POST /projects/1/accesses.json

Example:

// Using IDs
$basecamp->grantAccessToProject(123456, array("ids" => array(5, 6, 10)));

// Using email addresses (invite)
$basecamp->grantAccessToProject(12345, array("email_addresses" => array( "someone@example.com", "bob@example.com")));

docblock.description: Grant access to a specific calendar
docblock.long-description:
POST /calendar/1/accesses.json

Example:

// Using IDs
$basecamp->grantAccessToCalendar(123456, array("ids" => array(5, 6, 10)));

// Using email addresses (invite)
$basecamp->grantAccessToCalendar(12345, array("email_addresses" => array( "someone@example.com", "bob@example.com")));

docblock.description: Revoke access to projects
Revoke access to calendars
Retrieve all attachments
Retrieves token for attachment upload

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path of the file to be uploaded

tag.name: return
tag.description: Token to save locally to upload file

docblock.description: Creates new entry in the files section
docblock.long-description:
POST /projects/1/uploads.json

The attachments should be an array of file paths. Tokens are returned from createAttachment() and names will be created automatically. The subscribers (optional) is a list of ids that will be notified of file.

Example:

$basecamp->uploadFile(123456, array('content' => 'Test', 'subscribers' => array(1,4,2), 'attachments' => array('/path/to/file.png')));

docblock.description: Create a calendar event in a project
docblock.long-description:
POST /projects/1/calendar_events.json

The starts_at and ends_at parameters should be in ISO 8601 format (like "2012-08-16T16:00:00-05:00") The all_day parameter should be true or false.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current JSON representation of the project calendar event

docblock.description: Create a calendar event
docblock.long-description:
POST /calendars/1/calendar_events.json

The starts_at and ends_at parameters should be in ISO 8601 format (like "2012-08-16T16:00:00-05:00") The all_day parameter should be true or false.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current JSON representation of the calendar event

docblock.description: Updates a single calendar event in a project
docblock.long-description:
PUT /projects/1/calendar_events/1.json

The starts_at and ends_at parameters should be in ISO 8601 format (like "2012-08-16T16:00:00-05:00") The all_day parameter should be true or false.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current JSON representation of the calendar event

docblock.description: Updates a single calendar event in a specified calendar
docblock.long-description:
PUT /calendars/1/calendar_events/1.json

The starts_at and ends_at parameters should be in ISO 8601 format (like "2012-08-16T16:00:00-05:00") The all_day parameter should be true or false.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current JSON representation of the calendar event

docblock.description: Deletes a specified document from a project
Returns all global events between specified dates passed
docblock.long-description:
GET /events.json?since=0000-00-00T00:00:00-00:00&page=0

Returns 50 events per page. If the result has 50 entries, check next page. Datetime should be in the ISO 8601 format (like "0000:00:00T00:00:00-00:00").

tag.name: param
tag.description: The page number to begin query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current JSON representation of global events

docblock.description: Retieves 50 project events at a time, with pagination
docblock.long-description:
>GET /projects/1/events.json?since=0000-00-00T00:00:00-00:00&page=0

Returns 50 events per page. If the result has 50 entries, check next page. Datetime should be in the ISO 8601 format (like "0000:00:00T00:00:00-00:00").

tag.name: param
tag.description: The page number to begin query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current JSON representation of project events

docblock.description: Retrieves 50 person events at a time, with pagination
docblock.long-description:
GET /people/1/events.json?since=0000-00-00T00:00:00-00:00$page=0

Returns 50 events per page. If the result has 50 entries, check next page. Datetime should be in the ISO 8601 format (like "0000:00:00T00:00:00-00:00").

tag.name: param
tag.description: The page number to begin query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current JSON representation of user's events

docblock.description: Creates a todo item for a project
docblock.long-description:
POST /projects/1/todolists/1/todos.json

The due_at parameter should be in ISO 8601 format (like "2012-08-16T16:00:00-05:00") The assignee parameters need a type field with either Person or Group, the id is the ID of the person or group.

docblock.description: Update a single todo in a project
docblock.long-description:
PUT /projects/1/todos/1.json

The due_at parameter should be in ISO 8601 format (like "2012-08-16T16:00:00-05:00") The assignee parameters need a type field with either Person or Group, the id is the ID of the person or group.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current JSON representation of the todo if the creation was a success
